intro: Sisymbrium cavanillesianum, commonly known as the Cavanilles' mustards, is an annual flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many mustard species, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and elongated pods. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are pinnately lobed, and it produces a distinctive, pungent odor when crushed. Sisymbrium cavanillesianum is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value or used in traditional medicine.
